author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: The Mapmaker’s Colors
text:
Writers of fiction should rarely be trusted to explain their own books, but an exception can be made for Gerald Murnane, the 79-year-old Australian whose latest, “Border Districts” (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 132 pages, $22), appears alongside “Stream System” (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 548 pages, $18), a generous new collection of short works from the past 40 years. Mr. Murnane’s writing is so self-aware and so unorthodox that it’s worth letting him speak for himself.
“When I think of the word ‘fiction,’ ” he said in...
